entry.title: Interior Design Trends For 2024
entry.content:
In the dynamic world of interior design, 2024 emerges as a year where the design and fashion industry yet again converge, creating spaces that are timeless and understated.

 

Quiet Luxury

In 2024, the concept of 'quiet luxury' takes centre stage, offering a sophisticated and refined approach to interior design. Dark woods are gaining popularity, imparting a sense of warmth to spaces. Complementing these rich wood tones are luxurious soft textures like velvet and suede, creating an atmosphere of comfort and indulgence. This trend aligns seamlessly with fashion's preference for understated elegance, quality materials and timeless investment pieces that will be loved forever. 

 

Latte & Red  

The colour palette of 2024 interiors is dominated by the rich hues of red and brown. These warm, earthy tones bring a sense of coziness and sophistication to spaces. Deep burgundy, terracotta, and chocolate brown are making a strong statement in upholstery and decor elements. This infusion of classic colour resonates with the fashion world's emphasis on ‘latte dressing’, ‘latte makeup’ and the  ‘strawberry glaze’ trend - Hailey Bieber, we’re looking at you.     

Aged Gold/Walnut Armchair
Imogen Velvet Ottoman - Red

Marble

Marble, a material synonymous with timeless elegance, continues to be a focal point in interior design trends for 2024. From marble flooring to countertops and decor accents, this luxurious material adds a touch of sophistication to any space.

Marco Coffee Tables (Set of 2)

Mixing Textures

The art of mixing textures provides depth and visual interest to interiors in 2024. This trend involves layering various textures, such as smooth leather and velvet, to create a tactile and visually dynamic environment. Drawing parallels with the fashion industry's emphasis on texture and tactile elements, this trend encourages a multisensory approach to interior design. 

Big Artwork

Artwork continues to elevate interior spaces with commanding visual statements that form focal points of design. Embracing a philosophy of grandeur and bold expression, these large-scale artworks infuse spaces with plenty of character.

Matisse Gold Print

Silver Accents

Silver emerges as a prominent accent in 2024 interior design, due to its inherent versatility and timeless style that manages to feel classic and modern at the same.

Rothbury Silver Coffee Table

entry.title: A SYMPHONY OF DESIGN AND NATURE: The Furniture Gallery Redefines the Retail Experience with Extraordinary New Flagship Store
entry.content:
Buying furniture and home decor is a necessary but often mundane process, where we explore online options or navigate through a plain showroom. The Furniture Gallery is disrupting the norm with a brand new showroom that aims to transform the furniture shopping experience into something truly special, not to mention enjoyable. It’s 2024, so it’s about time furniture retail had a makeover and created some magic for its customers!

Nestled in the heart of Joondalup, the new showroom stands as a testament to The Furniture Gallery’s commitment to pushing the boundaries of creativity and offering Perth customers an immersive journey through the world of design. This extraordinary new showroom is redefining the retail experience with state-of-the-art architecture and innovative design elements that promise to captivate and inspire. So captivating and inspiring, in fact, that it’s well worth the travel - even if you’re on the south side of this beautiful city.

After all, who wouldn’t want to visit a showroom that some are already calling Perth’s most spectacular retail space?

A Vision of Architectural Brilliance

Designed by talented Perth architect Bryan Ho, the new Joondalup showroom seamlessly integrates form and function to create a space that is visually stunning, set over 3000 square meters. One of the standout features of the showroom is the expansive live vertical garden spanning over two levels, which might remind you of the incredible green walls you see at Singapore’s magnificent hanging gardens. Customers will have the opportunity to explore furniture collections amongst this lush backdrop, which keeps the space naturally cool and refreshing, not to mention incredibly aesthetic. Effortlessly blending organic and contemporary, the showroom also boasts a floating ‘butterfly’ staircase, architectural sky lights and glass elevator. Having previously worked on The Furniture Gallery’s other showrooms, Bryan Ho explains “we took elements that worked and stood out from each showroom like the live planter wall, the white marble counter, the feature podium stage showcasing new and promotional items, and the use of bronze tinted mirrors and timber.” But working with a much larger space, and taking these elements to the next level to form a new mega flagship showroom, was also part of the brief. “Because the showroom is huge, focal points were needed on both sides of the space,” says Ho. “As you walk into the showroom, the feature butterfly stairs became the main focal point complimenting the beautiful two level planter wall with the architectural sky lights that allow plenty of sunlight into the live plants. On the other side of the showroom, the feature glass lift becomes the focal point riding from the basement carpark.” All these features combine to invite customers into a world where design is not just a product, but an entire experience.

“Not Just Your Normal Furniture Store”

We have too many of those, after all. That’s why Directors Sophie Langa and Chrissy Palmer set out to create “one of the most beautiful showrooms in Australia.” With a clear vision in mind, Sophie says "we needed it to be an inspiring space, not just your normal furniture store. We want this place to be the catalyst for creative thinking, a place people can immerse themselves in a new experience. It’s the whole space that speaks to you, not just the product.” 

A Style Democracy

When you step inside any of the Furniture Gallery showrooms, you’ll find yourself immersed in a space showcasing each furniture display as a carefully curated vignette, so that you can envision how the designs integrate into your home, sparking inspiration and creativity. With exclusive collections from a host of Australian and international brands, The Furniture Gallery offers everything from minimalist contemporary pieces to opulent classics, Hamptons coastal, French Provincial, and everything in between. The diversity of styles ensures there’s something for every taste and preference. 

“We imagine a style democracy,” says Chrissy, “where everyone is empowered to realise their dream interior. To that end, FG provides the paintbrush, colours and palette (our furniture, decor and interior design consulting) to help execute unique expressions of living on the canvas that is your home.”  

As a couple of interior enthusiasts living in Perth, Chrissy notes “we were frustrated by the lack of choice of eclectic and on-trend furniture and home decor pieces in Perth at reasonable prices as well as the lack of expert design and styling advice available for people wanting to style their interiors. We saw a huge gap in the WA market for stylish furniture with a balance of affordability and great aesthetics. We wanted to recreate the feel of the serious interior inspiration we got when we visited beautiful showrooms on our world travels.” The new Joondalup showroom is the ultimate expression of that vision.

Something Special

In an era where online shopping dominates, The Furniture Gallery is committed to creating a transformative retail experience in store, including offering personalised consultations with in-house interior designers. The new Joondalup showroom realises that goal of adding something special to the consumer experience and transforming the mundane into the marvellous. Ready to visit your new favourite store in Perth? The Furniture Gallery Joondalup is open now!

In News:

entry.title: THE ULTIMATE SOFA
entry.content:
This is the Cloud. Our bestselling sofa designed to tick every box.
As dreamy as the name suggests, this lounge is truly one of a kind. 
Here's why you need the Cloud in your life...

Unparalleled Comfort

The Cloud's signature seating is filled with layers of plush goose feathers, so sitting feels more like floating - hence the name. This sensation makes the Cloud like no other lounge you've ever experienced, taking comfort to a whole new level.

2 Luxurious Fabrics   

Choose either the softest natural linen or supple cognac leather as your Cloud's upholstery when ordering online. 13 additional colours available exclusively in store.

A Sofa For a Lifetime

As a true modular, the Cloud is fully customisable to your space, with 3 unique pieces that can easily be configured in your preferred combination. Whether its your family or your home expanding, the Cloud can expand with you too. Simply add on pieces and the Cloud will grow with you to accommodate your changing lifestyle and interior. With a comprehensive lifetime warranty, this lounge is for life. And given how it's perfect in every way, you'll want to have it for life.

A Blank Canvas

The Cloud is not a sofa you'll need to change each time you move or as your style changes. The timeless, minimalist aesthetic means it will look inherently stylish and suit any type of decor. Dress it up with Hamptons coastal accessories, luxe velvet cushions in vibrant colours, or classic black and white. Check out our Instagram reels for ideas on the many ways you can style your Cloud.

SHOP THE CLOUD NOW

entry.title: 3 Reasons Why We Love Hamptons Style
entry.content:
The Hamptons. The Summer destination for the vacationing New York elite, and now one of the world's most popular interior styles. Synonymous with understated coastal elegance, we continue to turn to this style year after year to maintain Summer holiday vibes in our homes. 
 
Here are 3 reasons why Hamptons styling is our favourite interior theme for Summer and beyond...

TIMELESS

Trends come and go, but Hamptons style is always chic. Sophisticated and elegant, Hamptons styling has a refined look that oozes subtle luxury. It's no wonder that many celebrity homes celebrate Hamptons styling. We love using timeless pieces like upholstered armchairs, classy stripes, oversized lamps, grand chandeliers and glass coffee tables - mixing old and new for maximum effect.

LIGHT & BRIGHT

Is your home feeling a little dark? Hamptons furniture is sure to open up your interior thanks to the crisp white elements and neutral palette which create a sense of light and space. Complement these tones with muted greys and soft blues and greens, or contrast with splashes of navy and black.

RELAXING

We all want our home to feel like a haven, and Hamptons styling is perfect for achieving that. Natural materials like white-washed linens, timber, jute and rattan, along with calming ocean blues and lush greenery contribute to a tranquil, inviting space in which you can relax and entertain.

entry.title: Why You Should Choose Marri For Your Next Dining Table
entry.content:
As homeowners, we all strive to create a warm and inviting space in our homes that reflects our unique personalities and styles. A dining table is the centrepiece of any dining room, used for entertaining friends and family and memorable moments at home, so choosing the right one can make all the difference. If you're looking for a table that is not only functional but also beautiful and sustainable, then you should consider Marri.

Marri is a beautiful, native West Australian hardwood that offers a wide range of benefits for your home. Here are a few reasons why you should choose Marri for your next dining table:

BIOPHILIC DESIGN

Marri is a biophilic material, meaning it has a natural connection to the environment. Marri is a natural, organic material that brings the beauty of the outdoors into your home. The raw beauty of the wood and its unique features, such as knots, grains and a natural edge, add an organic touch to your home. This connection with nature has been shown to have a positive impact on our wellbeing and mood. Biophilic design is trending in 2023, with more people turning to nature and its elements to furnish their homes. Marri is the perfect choice for those who are looking to create a biophilic dining space.

DURABILITY

Marri is known for its robust strength and durability, making it ideal for furniture that will be used regularly. The natural oils in the wood make it resistant to moisture and decay, ensuring that your Marri dining table will last for years to come. This investment in a quality piece of furniture will pay off in the long run, as it will not only last longer but also look better over time.

A TIMELESS CLASSIC

Marri has a timeless beauty that will never go out of style. Other styles will date, but classic timber always looks on point. The warm, honey colored tone will complement any dining room décor. 
IGNACIO DINING TABLE
SIENNA DINING TABLE

entry.title: 3 Ideas For A Luxe Interior
entry.content:
Luxury interior design is all about adding sophistication and elegance to your home. It’s about creating an atmosphere that feels rich, comfortable and truly indulgent. When it comes to decorating your home with a luxe touch, there are three elements that you can incorporate to achieve that decadent look you’re after – velvet, mirrored furniture and statement designer art.

PLUSH VELVET

Velvet. This luxurious fabric is the epitome of sophistication and elegance. It’s soft to the touch, rich in colour and adds depth to any space it’s used in. If you’re looking to bring a touch of luxury to your bedroom, try the Ravello Bed, upholstered in smooth velvet and finished with classic buttoned tufting. For the living room, a velvet sofa like the Casablanca, featuring plush velvet and silver studding, will add a modern luxe touch.

MIRRORED FURNITURE

Mirrored furniture has been a popular trend for some time now and it’s not hard to see why. Not only does it reflect light, making a space feel brighter and more spacious, but it also adds a touch of glamour to any room. For a touch of luxury in your hallway or living room, consider the Amberley 2 Drawer Console. This console features gold metallic accents and an antique mirrored design, adding an eye-catching touch to your space. For a living room feature piece, the Pippard Coffee Table features a bevelled mirror top and a soft champagne metal frame, making it a modern and glam addition to your space.

STATEMENT DESIGNER ART

Art has the ability to completely transform a room, adding character and style to any space and creating a focal point for the room. The Fashion Pose print is a stunning, eye-catching piece set in glass with a double frame, reminiscent of fashion couture on the catwalk. Dramatic and alluring, this piece will set off other luxe furnishings and complete the look. View more art here.

entry.title: Maximalism - The 2023 Trend That's Taking Over Interiors
entry.content:
For years, minimalism has dominated the world of interior design. Clean lines, neutral colors, and sparse decor have been the go-to for those seeking a calm and clutter-free living space. However, in recent years, a new trend has been emerging that challenges the minimalist ideal. Maximalism is here, and it's all about bold colors, tactile textures, and playful decor choices.

BOLD COLOURS

While minimalism tends to rely on muted tones and neutral palettes, maximalism embraces bright, vibrant colours that add energy and personality to a space. Think jewel tones like emerald green, sapphire blue, and ruby red, or bright citrus hues like lemon yellow and tangerine orange. These bold colours can be used on walls, furniture, or as accents in the form of pillows, throws, or artwork. 

 

TACTILE TEXTURES

Maximalism also embraces tactile textures. This means incorporating materials like leather, velvet, and fur into your decor choices. These textures not only add visual interest but also make a space feel cozy and inviting. A velvet sofa in a bold colour makes a stunning centerpiece for the living room.

PERSONALITY

Never dull or boring, maximalism encourages playfulness in decor choices. Mix patterns, textures and styles to create a space that is eclectic, unique and full of personality. Don't be afraid to mix and match prints like stripes and florals, or pair a mid-century modern chair with a bohemian rug. 

 

LAYERS

Maximalism is about layering and abundance. This means incorporating multiple pieces of decor into a space to create a rich, layered look. This could be achieved through layering rugs, stacking books and decor, or displaying multiple pieces of artwork on one wall. The key is to create a space that feels full and abundant, without feeling cluttered or overwhelming.

STATEMENT PIECES

Statement pieces are bold, eye-catching pieces that command attention in a room. This could be a large piece of artwork, a sculptural lamp or an oversized lamp. These pieces add drama and personality to a space and can serve as a focal point around which the rest of the room is designed.

entry.title: 4 Ideas for a Cosy Bedroom This Winter
entry.content:
As the temperature drops and Winter settles in, it's time to transform your bedroom into a warm and inviting sanctuary. Here are four easy tips to get your bedroom looking and feeling cosy this Winter...

Layer Up with Throws and Cushions

Throws are the ultimate Winter accessory for your bedroom, adding both warmth and style. Drape a few soft, plush throws over your bed, armchair, or ottoman for a touch of luxury and comfort, and layer up with textured cushions for extra cosiness. Choose materials like fur, velvet, or chunky knit to create a homely vibe.

Warm Up with Rich Colours

Incorporating warmer, richer colours into your bedroom can create an instant feeling of cosy comfort. Consider deep tones like burgundy, rust or forest green for your bedding and accent pieces. These colours can evoke a sense of warmth and help to balance the cooler tones in your room.

Illuminate Your Space with Soft Lighting

When it comes to creating a cozy atmosphere, lighting is essential. Swap out bright, harsh lights for soft, warm bulbs that cast a gentle glow over your bedroom.

entry.title: How to Create Your Dream Coastal Living Room
entry.content:
Bringing the tranquil beauty of the coast into your home has never been easier with the right furnishings. A coastal-inspired living room embraces a laidback lifestyle that is perfect for relaxation and entertaining guests. The key to creating a coastal living room is to strike a balance between comfort and style. Here’s a step-by-step guide on how to create your dream coastal living room with some of our favorite pieces. 

Step 1: Choose a neutral colour palette

The coastal living room should have a light, airy and neutral colour palette. A mix of soft blues, greens, grays, and whites will give you that relaxed, beachy feel. This colour scheme creates a serene and calming atmosphere, perfect for unwinding after a long day.

Step 2: Pick a comfortable and stylish sofa

A comfortable and stylish sofa is the centrepiece of your living room. The Cloud Modular is the ultimate sofa for a coastal living room, with its 100% goose feather-filled cushions encased in soft cream linen. Three separate modular pieces (corner, armless and ottoman) offer endless configurations to fit your space. 

Step 3: Add a statement coffee table   

The Hampton Coffee Table is the perfect addition to your coastal living room. This stunning oversized coffee table has a crisp white timber frame, cross detailing, practical shelving and a glass top, offering a timeless, classic look. 

Step 4: Bring in some art 

Adding wall art is a great way to personalize your living room and create a focal point. The Santorini View Square is an ocean-inspired artwork print that captures the surreal Caldera views in Santorini.  

Step 5: Add a coastal-inspired accent chair  

Use armchairs with natural materials like rattan and linen to add freshness to your living room. The Marseille Armchair is a rattan armchair with beige upholstered seating for extra comfort. This elegant and stately armchair will add a touch of sophistication to your coastal living room. 

Step 6: Accessorize 

Add the finishing touches to your coastal living room with decorative pillows, a throw blanket, and some vases. Consider adding a few nautical-themed accents such as seashells or starfish to really tie the whole room together.
